featured.title: In Photos: Exclusive first look at New College House West
featured.description: New College House West is welcoming its first residents after two years of construction. Here's an exclusive first look at its features.

news.title: Your questions about Penn move-in, answered
news.description: Students will need to be masked and vaccinated in order to enter their dorms.

news.title: New College House West welcomes students for social, amenity-filled living experience
news.description: The building, which cost a record-shattering $169.5 million to complete, offers suite-style apartments with a dining cafe, private courtyard, coffee bar, and spectacular views of the city.

news.title: Five Guys to open on Penn's campus this fall
news.description: Five Guys is a casual eatery which serves fast food like hamburgers and french fries.

news.title: Ten tips for navigating your first in-person semester at Penn
news.description: The Daily Pennsylvanian reached out to Penn students and faculty for advice on how incoming first years, transfer students, and sophomores can succeed in their first in-person semester.

news.title: Class of 2024 to attend first-ever second-year orientation
news.description: Members of the Class of 2024 will be able to participate in specialized programming overseen by the office of New Student Orientation & Academic Initiatives.

news.title: New sushi bar and expanded meal swipe options among Penn Dining’s fall semester updates
news.description: Penn Dining will also open several new dining locations and will use electronic kiosks and mobile apps to streamline the ordering process.

news.title: In-person classes and accessible class recordings: A guide to Penn’s academic scene
news.description: Undergraduate courses will be delivered in person with limited exceptions, remaining in line with administrators’ original plans announced in April.

news.title: Here's how Penn's amenities will operate this fall
news.description: From libraries to gyms, there will be a variety of facilities open for student use this semester.

news.title: Professors improvise COVID-19 classroom safety measures as Delta variant surges
news.description: Concerned about the rise in Philadelphia's COVID-19 cases linked to Delta variant, some faculty members are improvising their own classroom safety measures while anticipating further guidance from Penn.

news.title: Penn professors largely optimistic Gutmann can rebuild relations as U.S. ambassador to Germany
news.description: Some Penn professors hope Gutmann can repair U.S.-Germany relations, particularly as Germany will be going through a transition period after their federal election next month.

news.title: A rundown of Penn’s FGLI student resources this fall
news.description: Students can join various FGLI-oriented clubs and take advantage of academic resources

opinion.title: The lessons we should take from online class
opinion.description: The Editorial Board argues that professors should carry over some practices of the virtual semesters to in-person learning.

opinion.title: This semester, let’s add gratitude to our routine
opinion.description: Columnist Jaden Cloobeck speaks to how we can improve mental wellness on campus, such as by keeping a gratitude journal.

sports.title: 10 things everyone should know about Penn Athletics
sports.description: From Penn Athletics' storied past to its exciting and ever-changing present, this article touches all of the bases of Red and Blue sports.

sports.title: Penn's Olympians: How nine Quakers fared in the 2020 Games
sports.description: Tokyo marked the Olympic debuts for all nine athletes

sports.title: Penn Athletics Fall preview: Soccer, field hockey, football season expectations
sports.description: The Red and Blue will have a greater-than-usual influx of new talent

sports.title: Guest column | Simone Biles proved the scary reality of the twisties and mental health in gymnastics
sports.description: Many gymnasts have reported dealing with similar struggles as Biles, as the twisties are a common issue in the sport
